biography.value:
“An enormous dragonfly blocks out the sun, except for the iridescent shadows filtered through its diaphanous wings. Its three tails gouge into the land like plows before it darts off in a random direction.”

A full-grown dawnfly is an incredibly rare sight, a massive creature that emerges once every few years and lives for little more than a week. However, it can destroy a vast swathe of crops and homes in that brief period of time.

Larval Stage.

A dawnfly starts life as a desolation nymph. Unlike their smaller cousins, which turn into dragonflies, the life cycle of the desolation nymph is complex. Only occasionally do the nymphs mature into giant dragonflies and even then, not until after several years or even decades, as a nymph. Some remain a nymph for the whole of their lives. A nymph that survives at least a decade may transform into the terrifying dawnfly in the final days of its life.

Predatory Larva.

Desolation nymphs hide as best they can among mangrove roots or giant reeds; they prefer to hunt near water. When prey is close, the nymph rapidly extends its lower jaw, arrayed with hooks and spines, to capture and devour its prey.

Dire Omen.

The reason for a dawnfly's emergence is a mystery. Some view it as a harbinger of terrible times, or the avatar of any number of gods associated with death and destruction, or the herald of some demon lord or arch-devil associated with insects. All agree that, regardless of its origin, the dawnfly is a powerfully destructive force capable of eliminating entire civilizations.

description.value: The dawnfly makes one Bite attack and three Tail attacks.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+12]]{+12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 ([[/damage 3d8 + 6 type=piercing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=poison]]) damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+12]]{+12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 22 ([[/damage 3d10 + 6 type=bludgeoning]]) damage.

The dawnfly flies up to 40 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Huge or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=19]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 54 ([[/damage 12d8 type=slashing]]) damage and is &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of its next turn. If the dawnfly's wings are ignited from Winged Inferno, the creature takes an extra 14 ([[/damage 4d6 type=fire]]) damage. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't &Reference[condition=stunned].
The dawnfly doesn't provoke @action[opportunity attack||opportunity attacks] when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
The dawnfly deals double damage to objects and structures.

A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dawnfly must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=19]] saving throw or become &Reference[condition=incapacitated] until the start of its next turn. &Reference[condition=Deafened] creatures have advantage on the saving throw. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the dawnfly's Unsettling Drone for the next 24 hours.

The dawnfly rapidly beats its wings igniting them until the start of its next turn. Its wings shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light an additional 20 feet. A creature that touches the dawnfly or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=fire]]) damage. In addition, when a creature starts its turn within 5 feet of the dawnfly, that creature must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=19]] saving throw or take 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=fire]]) damage. This effect ends early if the dawnfly stops flying.

The dawnfly's wings shed blinding dust within 10 feet of it. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=19]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=blinded] until the end of its next turn.

The dawnfly's wings beat furiously, releasing a downdraft of heated air in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save ability=strength dc=19]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ([[/damage 2d8 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=fire]]) damage, is pushed up to 15 feet away from the dawnfly in a direction following the cone, and is knocked &Reference[condition=prone]. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked &Reference[condition=prone].

The dawnfly flies up to half its flying speed, making one Tail attack at a creature within its reach along the way. If the attack hits, the creature is &Reference[condition=grappled] and carried with the dawnfly, which immediately drops the creature at the end of the movement. The creature takes falling damage, as normal.

The dawnfly can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dawnfly regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.Qhgo1hl0Zbmc4WP2.Item.oXkWuSfLV16A1J0K]{Dust Burst}
  • @UUID[Actor.Qhgo1hl0Zbmc4WP2.Item.qDVsxQLldEsqMyPB]{Fiery Downburst}
  • @UUID[Actor.Qhgo1hl0Zbmc4WP2.Item.i3CLvSX12btufmQL]{Snatch and Drop}
